title: How to Change the Time on a Nintendo DS, DSi, or 3DS

methods.name: Changing Time on DS and DS Lite

steps.headline: Remove all the games from the DS and turn it on.
Tap on the settings panel after you get to the main menu.
Go to the calendar and time icon, which as a picture of a calendar and a clock on it.
Select the time icon, which has a clock on it.

methods.name: Changing Time on DSi and DSi XL

steps.headline: Remove all the games from the DSi and turn it on.
Tap on the Settings icon, which has a wrench-like tool on it.
Go to the next page until you see the "Time" button.
Insert the time and tap on "OK".
Choose the Settings icon in the main menu, and tap on the "Open" button.
Tap on the "Other Settings" button, then the Date/Time one.
Select the "Current Time" icon and insert the time.

text: Changing Time on DS and DS Lite Remove all the games from the DS and turn it on.  Tap on the settings panel after you get to the main menu.  Go to the calendar and time icon, which as a picture of a calendar and a clock on it.  Select the time icon, which has a clock on it.  Insert the time and tap "confirm".  Changing Time on DSi and DSi XL Remove all the games from the DSi and turn it on.  Tap on the Settings icon, which has a wrench-like tool on it.  Go to the next page until you see the "Time" button.  Insert the time and tap on "OK".  Changing Time on 3DS Turn on your 3DS.  Choose the Settings icon in the main menu, and tap on the "Open" button.  Tap on the "Other Settings" button, then the Date/Time one.  Select the "Current Time" icon and insert the time.  Tap on "OK".
